titleStmt.title: The virtuous woman found her loss bewayl'd, and character exemplified in a sermon preach't at Felsted in Essex, at the funeral of the most excellent and religious lady, the Right Honourable Mary Countess Dowager of Warwick. By Anthony Walker D.D. rector of Fyfield in the said county. To which are annexed some of her ladyships pious and useful meditations.
titleStmt.author: Walker, Anthony, d. 1692.

titleStmt.title: The virtuous woman found her loss bewayl'd, and character exemplified in a sermon preach't at Felsted in Essex, at the funeral of the most excellent and religious lady, the Right Honourable Mary Countess Dowager of Warwick. By Anthony Walker D.D. rector of Fyfield in the said county. To which are annexed some of her ladyships pious and useful meditations.
titleStmt.author: Walker, Anthony, d. 1692.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Nathanael Ranew at the King's Arms in St. Paul's Church-Yard,

notesStmt.note: IU Copy tightly bound and pages stained, with slight loss of text.
Imperfect: L copy stained, tightly bound, torn throughout, with pp. 65-66 and 75-76 failed to print, and pp. 113-124 lacking.
Reproduction of originals in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library (reel 1981) and the British Library (reel 1878).
